CatDescriptText: Mrs. Tiny Irwin [Irvin] Velar, 516 Center Street, Braddock, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 15, 1958, pg. 2, with question: "Do you think that the numbers game should be legalized or outlawed?" Answer reads: "I think that they should be legalized. in first place, if people want to spend their money that way, it might as well be spent and made within the law.  Also, if they are going to sneak around and play the numbers, this is another reason why they should be made legal."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Tiny Irvin Velar, wearing light colored cape, short dark leather gloves, and eyeglasses with wing design, standing on Liberty Avenue with May building in background with Thrift Drugs and Kappel's, Downtown
